definition:
A field $K$ is called *separably algebraically closed* if every
separable element of the algebraic closure of $K$ belongs to $K$. In the
case when $K$ has characteristic 0, it is separably algebraically closed
if and only if it is algebraically closed.If $K$ has positive
characteristic $p$, $K$ is separably algebraically closed if and only if
its algebraic closure is a purely inseparable extension of $K$.
